title: 108_hr3052
content: The Act titled "State Accountability and Identity Fraud Elimination Act of 2004" allows for the withholding of funds for the enactment of a law that permits the issuance of identification cards or driver's licenses for certain individuals. The Act "State Accountability and Identity Fraud Elimination Act of 2004" allows withholding funds from states that enact laws allowing issuance of identification cards or driver's licenses for certain individuals. This includes withholding 5% of funds in fiscal year 2006 and 10% in fiscal year 2007. In fiscal years 2008, 2009, and 2010, the Secretary will withhold increasing percentages of funds from states that have enacted specific laws related to identification cards or driver's licenses. In fiscal years 2008, 2009, and 2010, the Secretary will withhold increasing percentages of funds from states that have enacted laws allowing the issuance of identification cards or driver's licenses to unauthorized aliens. The Secretary will withhold funds from states allowing IDs for unauthorized aliens. Funds withheld before Sept 30, 2007, remain available for 3 years. Funds withheld after Sept 30, 2007, are not available for apportionment. If a State repeals a law related to unauthorized aliens before the last day of the withholding period, the Secretary will apportion the remaining funds to the State. The apportioned funds are available for expenditure for three fiscal years, after which any unspent sums will lapse. If a State does not repeal a law related to unauthorized aliens before the withholding period ends, the funds withheld will lapse. Withholding of funds for enactment of a law allowing issuance of identification cards or drivers' licenses for certain individuals.
